item.title: 不断恶化的天气正在点燃一个价值 250 亿美元的市场
item.description:

As companies and investors come to grips with meteorological risks, they’re looking to a niche corner of Wall Street for protection.

】

item.title: 利润前景恶化威胁标普 500 指数 20% 的涨幅
item.description: 美国公司强劲的盈利业绩可能不再足以维持股票涨势。利润前景正变得越来越重要。【原文：Strong earnings beats from Corporate America may no longer be enough to keep the stock rally going. Profit outlooks are becoming more important.】

item.title: 巴菲特的伯克希尔公司称现金创纪录，收益增加
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.营业利润也有所增长。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s cash pile hit yet another record as billionaire investor Warren Buffett confronted a dearth of big-ticket deals. Operating earnings also rose.】

item.title: 日本儿童人口创历史新低，影响经济增长
item.description: 日本的儿童人数再创历史新低，这清楚地提醒人们，亚洲第二大经济体正面临着严峻的人口挑战。【原文：The number of children in Japan has dropped to another record, in a stark reminder of the demographic challenges that are weighing on Asia’s second biggest economy.】

item.title: 777 合作伙伴的贷款人在诉讼中指控欺诈和双重抵押
item.description: 777 Partners 的贷款人指控该公司欺诈，称这家总部位于迈阿密的投资公司以 3.5 亿美元的资产为抵押借款，而这些资产要么不属于该公司，要么根本不存在。【原文：Lenders to 777 Partners accused it of fraud, claiming that the Miami-based investment firm borrowed against $350 million of assets that either it didn’t own or didn’t exist.】

item.title: 巴菲特将吸引大批观众，但芒格的俏皮话将被错过
item.description: 内布拉斯加州奥马哈（美联社）— 数万名投资者预计将于周六再次来到内布拉斯加州奥马哈市的一个竞技场，聆听亿万富翁沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的智慧之言。但在伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的年度股东大会上，将缺少一个关键要素：这是副董事长查理-芒格去世后的首次股东大会。【原文：OMAHA, Neb. (AP) — Tens of thousands of investors are expected to once again descend on an Omaha, Nebraska, arena Saturday to vacuum up tidbits of wisdom from billionaire Warren Buffett. But a key ingredient will be missing from his annual Berkshire Hathaway shareholders’ meeting: It's the first since Vice Chairman Charlie Munger died.】

item.title: 菲律宾央行收紧脏钱风险报告规则
item.description: 菲律宾中央银行将要求金融机构在发现与洗钱和恐怖主义融资有关的风险后 24 小时内提交报告，因为这个东南亚国家正在加大打击非法交易的力度。【原文：The Philippines central bank will require financial institutions to submit a report within 24 hours of discovering risks linked to money laundering and terrorist financing, as the Southeast Asian nation steps up its fight against illicit transactions.】

item.title: 火山爆发后，印度尼西亚转移了 10,000 人
item.description: 印尼北苏拉威西省的一座活火山可能会爆发更多火山爆发，人们担心火山爆发会造成更多损失，因此印尼将永久性迁移约 10,000 名居住在岛上的居民。【原文：Indonesia will permanently relocate some 10,000 people living on an island in North Sulawesi following concerns that more eruptions could come from an active volcano that has already caused damages.】

item.title: 古尔斯比称美联储可更好地传达其对经济的反应方式
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，决策者应考虑如何改进他们对经济形势看法的沟通方式，以及如何将这些看法纳入对利率的预测。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said policymakers should consider ways to improve how they communicate their views on economic conditions and how those feed into their projections for interest rates.】

item.description: 两年前，花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Two years after a Citigroup Inc. trader’s fat-finger error briefly sent European stocks swooning, the bank said authorities are investigating what happened.】

item.title: 俄罗斯人因加密货币洗钱在美国认罪
item.description: 美国检察官说，一名俄罗斯人承认了与他在 2011 年至 2017 年期间运营加密货币交易所 BTC-e 有关的洗钱阴谋。【原文：A Russian national pleaded guilty to a money laundering conspiracy related to his role in operating the cryptocurrency exchange BTC-e from 2011 to 2017, US prosecutors said.】

item.title: 美国联邦储蓄委员会主任称 "大到不能倒 "的银行具有不公平优势
item.description: 美国消费者金融保护局局长罗希特-乔普拉（Rohit Chopra）表示，美国的银行业环境需要更加公平竞争，因为对美国人来说，金融选择的减少意味着结果的恶化。【原文：The US banking landscape needs to be more of a level playing field, as fewer financial choices means worse outcomes for Americans, according to US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Director Rohit Chopra.】

item.title: 吉利旗下电动汽车制造商 Zeekr 寻求在美国 IPO 筹集 3.68 亿美元资金
item.description: 浙江吉利控股集团有限公司旗下的高端电动汽车品牌 Zeekr Intelligent Technology Holding Ltd. 正寻求在美国首次公开募股中筹集高达 3.675 亿美元的资金。【原文：Zeekr Intelligent Technology Holding Ltd., the high-end electric car brand under Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co., is seeking to raise as much as $367.5 million in a US initial public offering.】

item.title: 银行家奖金回扣即将投票，结果尚不明朗
item.description: 监管机构最快将于下周再次尝试实施相关规定，迫使银行从承担过多风险的高管那里收回薪酬，尽管反对意见曾两次导致改革失败。【原文：Regulators will try again as soon as next week to impose rules that would force banks to claw back pay from executives who take too much risk, despite opposition that doomed reforms twice before.】

item.title: 银行家奖金回扣即将投票，结果尚不明朗

item.title: 圭亚那就虚报设备价值将埃克森公司告上法庭
item.description: 圭亚那税务局将埃克森美孚公司告上法庭，因为该公司的一家供应商称其错误地将油井设备的价值夸大了 200 倍，达到约 120 亿美元。【原文：Guyana’s tax agency is taking Exxon Mobil Corp. to court after one of the company’s suppliers said it mistakenly inflated the value of oil-well equipment by 200 times to about $12 billion.】

item.title: 巴西寻求通过巴西国家石油公司增加天然气供应
item.description: 巴西矿产和能源部长亚历山大-西尔维拉（Alexandre Silveira）表示，巴西石油巨头巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）应加大力度促进天然气供应并降低天然气价格，以帮助振兴巴西工业。【原文：Brazil’s oil giant Petrobras should increase its efforts to boost natural gas supplies and lower prices to help revive the nation’s industry, said mines and energy minister Alexandre Silveira.】

item.title: 惠誉上调埃及在 570 亿美元全球救助后的前景展望
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）将埃及的信用评级展望从 "稳定 "上调至 "积极"，此前这个北非国家获得了 570 亿美元的国际救助，以缓解其资金紧张的经济状况。【原文：Egypt’s credit rating outlook was raised to positive from stable by Fitch Ratings, after the North African nation secured an international bailout of $57 billion for its cash-strapped economy.】

item.title: 惠誉将尼日利亚改革后的债务评级展望改为正面
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）将尼日利亚的信用评级前景从 "稳定 "上调至 "积极"，六个月前，该公司曾表示，自博拉-蒂努布总统去年 5 月上台以来，尼日利亚的改革进展速度超出了其预期。【原文：Nigeria’s credit rating outlook was lifted by Fitch Ratings to positive from stable, six months after it said that reform progress since President Bola Tinubu came to power in May of last year was faster than it anticipated.】

item.title: 继惠誉之后，S&P 上调土耳其信用评级
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司上调了土耳其的信用评级，这得益于政府重新采取了更为正统的政策。【原文：Turkey’s credit rating was upgraded by S&P Global Ratings, aided by the government’s return to more orthodox policies.】

item.title: 原油价格暴跌，对冲基金加大原油看跌押注
item.description: 随着美国原油价格跌至七周多来的最低点，对冲基金纷纷押注看跌美国原油。【原文：Hedge funds piled into bearish bets in US crude as prices plummeted toward the lowest in more than seven weeks.】

item.title: 痴迷于美联储的交易员需要让经济恢复正轨
item.description: 又是一个经济信号相互冲突的星期，又是一个华尔街交易员试图在依赖数据的美联储面前跑马圈地的惨痛教训。【原文：Another week of conflicting economic signals — and another painful lesson for Wall Street traders trying to front run the data-dependent Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 乌克兰放松对企业的部分战时资本管制
item.description: 乌克兰中央银行放宽了对企业的一些外汇限制，此举被称为自 2022 年俄罗斯全面入侵以来最大的货币市场自由化举措。【原文：Ukraine’s central bank eased some foreign exchange restrictions for businesses, a move it called the biggest currency market liberalization since Russia’s full-scale invasion in 2022.】

item.title: IQera 债券持有人选择 Houlihan 和 Gibson Dunn 进行债务谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，法国债务清收商 iQera Group SAS 的一批债券持有人已选定法律和财务顾问，与该公司进行资产负债表重组谈判。【原文：A group of French debt collector iQera Group SAS’s bondholders have selected legal and financial advisers to engage with the company in balance sheet restructuring talks, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: TCW 投资总监 Whalen 警告信贷市场 "末日来临
item.description: 布赖恩-惠伦（Bryan Whalen）在 TCW 集团的固定收益团队管理着超过 1,700 亿美元的资金，他警告说，在投资者纷纷涌入公司债之后，信贷市场可能会面临调整。【原文：Bryan Whalen, whose fixed income team at TCW Group oversees more than $170 billion, warns that credit markets will probably face a correction after investors have stampeded into corporate debt.】

item.title: 三分之一打包成债券的办公楼抵押贷款面临违约风险
item.description: 根据 KBRA Analytics 的数据，3 月份商业抵押债券中约有 520 亿美元（31%）的办公楼贷款出现问题。【原文：About $52 billion, or 31%, of all office loans in commercial mortgage bonds were in trouble in March, according to KBRA Analytics.】

item.title: 小型远程医疗公司股票暴跌 85%，狂热的首次公开募股热潮轰然倒塌
item.description: 新加坡远程医疗服务提供商 Mobile-Health Network Solutions 曾是今年美国 IPO 表现最好的公司，自 4 月份上市以来首次跌破 IPO 发行价。【原文：The Singaporean telehealth provider Mobile-Health Network Solutions, once the top-performing US IPO this year, tumbled below its IPO price for the first time since its April public listing.】

item.title: 奇货通讯：混合信号和黄旗
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: 审计师被美国证券交易委员会禁入后，预计特朗普媒体将推迟发布财报
item.description: 投资者正在等待唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体初创公司的最新进展情况，在看到财务业绩之前，他们还得再等上一段时间— 有些人甚至要等上几个月—。【原文：Investors waiting for an update of how Donald Trump’s media startup is faring will have to wait a bit longer — months by some accounts — before getting a look at financial results.】
